p.4: Our Data Science team is developing machine learning models to forecast electricity consumption and optimization algorithms to determine how much to charge/discharge the battery given those forecasts as well as some economic incentives (tariffs, wholesale market, etc).
p.6: As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will help productionize algorithms for time series forecasting and optimization. We are building an event-based system to maximize customer savings given uncertainty, and need a Machine Learning Engineer to help implement software best practices to ensure the various algorithms are robust and capable of iterative development.
p.8: The Data Science team is small, so you will likely also help the ML Ops Engineer with building out the machine learning platform, the Data Engineer with building the ETL pipeline, and the Data Scientists with experimentation and model development.
p.10: Our goal is to build world-class algorithms in a highly collaborative environment.

li: Work with Forecasting and Optimization Engineers to help design and implement production quality code
li.1: Work with ML Ops engineer to design and implement the component parts of our machine learning platform
li.2: Work with Data Engineer on ETL platform
li.3: Help forecasting engineer prototype new and refine existing algorithms

li.1: Experience deploying machine learning models to production

li: Experience with probabilistic time series models
li.3: Experience with Kafka streaming jobs for ETL
